types.name: Query
types.description:
Queries for the Manifold GraphQL API.

More details and usage available on the
[platform documentation page](https://docs.manifold.co/docs/graphql-apis-AWRk3LPzpjcI5ynoCtuZs).

fields.name: provider
fields.description:
Look up a Provider by it's `id` or `label`. Exactly one of `id` or `label` is
required, and `id` has precedence over `label`.

fields.name: plan
fields.description: Look up a Plan by its `id`. `id` is required.

fields.name: product
fields.description: Look up a product by its `id` or label. Exactly one of `id` or `label` is required, and `id` has precedence over `label`.

fields.name: categories
fields.description: List all available categories in the system.

fields.name: category
fields.description: Look up a category by its label.

fields.name: products
fields.description: List all available products

fields.name: profile
fields.description:
Look up a profile by `id`, `subject` or based on the currently authenticated profile.

Note: this query can only be performed when authenticated.

fields.name: node
fields.description: Look up a node by its `id`.

fields.name: resources
fields.description:
Resources will return a paginated list of resources. It will either contain
all available resources linked to the token, or it will be filtered down to
fetch data for the specified profile. The owner can either be a ProfileID or
a Subject ID which represents the ProfileID within a specific Platform.

Note: this is currently only available with a Platform API Token.

fields.name: resource
fields.description:
Fetch a resource for the specific label or ID. When authenticated as a
profile, this will fetch the resource associated with the profile. If
authenticated as a platform, an owner needs to be provided when a label is
used.

Note: this is currently only available with a Platform API Token.

fields.name: profiles
fields.description:
Profiles will return a paginated list of profiles for a Platform, optionally
querying for only profiles with subscription usage over a provided time.

Note: this is currently only available with a Platform API Token.

fields.name: invoice
fields.description: Look up an invoice by its `id`.

fields.name: lineItem
fields.description: Look up a line item by it's `id`.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Provider
types.description: A Provider in Manifold's catalog. Providers own Products.

fields.name: label
fields.description: A URL friendly label for this Provider. Globally unique.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: A human readble display name for this Provider.

fields.name: logoUrl
fields.description: The URL of the logo for this Provider.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL of this Provider's primary website.

fields.name: supportEmail
fields.description: The email address for contacting this Provider with support requests.

fields.name: products
fields.description: The list of products associated with this provider.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: ProductOrderBy
types.description: ProductOrderBy defines how a product connection is to be ordered.

types.name: ProductOrderByField
types.description: ProductOrderByField is a the field by which a Product list will be ordered.

types.name: OrderByDirection
types.description: The direction use to order results.

types.name: ProductConnection
types.description: A ProductConnection is the connection containing Product edges

types.name: ProductEdge
types.description: A ProductEdge is an edge of a ProductConnection

types.name: Product
types.description: A Product is a provider's product

fields.name: provider
fields.description:
Provider is the provider associated with this product. It can be null if
providerID is null or a provider cannot be retrieved.

fields.name: state
fields.description: State is the currect product state.

fields.name: screenshots
fields.description: Screenshots are a list of all the images set for this product listing details.

fields.name: valueProps
fields.description: ValueProps is a list of property values with a header and a body. It is non-nullable, but it can be empty.

fields.name: valuePropsHtml
fields.description: ValuePropsHtml is the HTML representation of the value propositions. It is non-nullable, but it can be empty.

fields.name: setupStepsHtml
fields.description:
SetupStepsHtml is the HTML representation of the setup steps required to
configure a new product. It is non-nullable, but it can be empty.

fields.name: plans
fields.description: List Plans associated with the product

types.name: ProductState
types.description: ProductState is an enum of possible product states.

types.name: ProductIntegration
types.description: ProductIntegration contains information about integrating products.

types.name: ProductScreenshot
types.description: ProductScreenshot includes the information to find and order a screenshot.

types.name: ValueProp
types.description: ValueProp is a property value

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: PlanOrderBy
types.description: PlanOrderBy defines how a plan connection is to be ordered.

types.name: PlanOrderByField
types.description: PlanOrderByField is a the field by which a plan list will be ordered.

types.name: PlanConnection
types.description: A PlanConnection is the connection between a Plan and its containing Product

types.name: PlanEdge
types.description: A PlanEdge is an edge of a PlanConnection

types.name: Plan
types.description: A Plan is a plan in a product

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: A human readable display name for this plan.

fields.name: label
fields.description:
A URL friendly label for this Region, combining its platform and dataCenter
with a hyphen. Globally unique.

fields.name: product
fields.description: The product this plan is associated with.

fields.name: state
fields.description: The current state of the plan.

fields.name: fixedFeatures
fields.description: A list of fixed features associated with the plan.

fields.name: meteredFeatures
fields.description: A list of metered features associated with the plan.

fields.name: configurableFeatures
fields.description: A list of configurable features associated with the plan.

fields.name: cost
fields.description: The plan's base cost without the addition of metered features costs

fields.name: free
fields.description: If the plan is free, including if there are metered features changing the cost of a plan with base cost 0.

fields.name: regions
fields.description: The datacenters associated with this plan.

types.name: PlanState
types.description: PlanState is an enumeration of possible Plan states.

types.name: FixedFeaturesOrderBy
types.description: Order by which to sort fixed features.

types.name: FixedFeaturesOrderByField
types.description: Fields by which to sort fixed features.

types.name: PlanFixedFeatureConnection
types.description: PlanFixedFeaturesConnection is the connection between a plan and its value properties.

types.name: PageInfo
types.description:
PageInfo provides support for
[Relay](https://facebook.github.io/relay/graphql/connections.htm) cursor
connections style pagination.

types.name: PlanFixedFeatureEdge
types.description: PlanFixedFeatureEdge is an edge of a PlanFixedFeatureConnection.

types.name: PlanFixedFeature
types.description: PlanFixedFeature is a value property of a plan.

types.name: MeteredFeaturesOrderBy
types.description: Order by which to sort metered features.

types.name: MeteredFeaturesOrderByField
types.description: Fields by which to sort metered features.

types.name: PlanMeteredFeatureConnection
types.description: PlanMeteredFeatureConnection is the connection between a plan and its metered properties.

types.name: PlanMeteredFeatureEdge
types.description: PlanMeteredFeatureEdge is an edge of a PlanMeteredFeatureConnection.

types.name: PlanMeteredFeature
types.description: PlanMeteredFeature is a metered feature of a plan.

types.name: PlanMeteredFeatureNumericDetails
types.description: PlanMeteredFeatureNumericDetails contains the numeric details of a metered plan feature.

types.name: PlanFeatureCostTier
types.description: PlanFeatureCostTier represents a cost tier in a plan.

types.name: ConfigurableFeaturesOrderBy
types.description: Order by which to sort configurable features.

types.name: ConfigurableFeaturesOrderByField
types.description: Fields by which to sort configurable features.

types.name: PlanConfigurableFeatureConnection
types.description: PlanConfigurableFeatureConnection is the connection between a plan and its configurable properties.

types.name: PlanConfigurableFeatureEdge
types.description: PlanConfigurableFeatureEdge is an edge of a PlanConfigurableFeatureConnection.

types.name: PlanConfigurableFeature
types.description: PlanConfigurableFeature is a configurable feature of a plan.

types.name: PlanFeatureType
types.description: PlanFeatureType is an enumeration of different types of plans.

types.name: PlanConfigurableFeatureNumericDetails
types.description: PlanConfigurableFeatureNumericDetails contains the numeric details of a configurable plan feature.

types.name: RegionsOrderBy
types.description: RegionsOrderBy is an input defining how to order regions.

types.name: RegionsOrderByField
types.description: RegionsOrderByField is an enum of fields to order regions by.

types.name: Region
types.description: A Region is a Data Center within a cloud provider's platform.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: A human readble display name for this Region.

fields.name: platform
fields.description: The commercial cloud provider that hosts the Region.

fields.name: dataCenter
fields.description: A platform specific data center identifier.

types.name: Category
types.description: Category is a category an entity is in.

types.name: CategoryConnection
types.description: CategoryConnection is a connection between an entity and its categories.

types.name: CategoryEdge
types.description: CategoryEdge is an edge of a CategoryConnection.

types.name: ProfileIdentity
types.description:
ProfileIdentity allows fetching a profile by its `id` or
by its `subject`.

types.name: Profile
types.description: Profile represents a consumer in the Manifold system.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the profile which is internally used.

fields.name: subject
fields.description: Subject represents the identifier of the profile on the platform's side.

fields.name: platform
fields.description: Platform represents the platform this profile belongs to.

fields.name: invoicePreview
fields.description:
InvoicePreview represents the preview of the customer’s invoice
for the current billing cycle as of midnight UTC.

An invoice preview consist of the amount due and related details at
a specific moment in time. It does not represent an estimation of the
amount that will be due at the end of the billing cycle.

*This is only an invoice preview. It should not be used to charge users.*

Note: this is currently only available with a Platform API Token.

fields.name: invoices
fields.description:
Invoices will return a paginated list of invoices.

Note: this is currently only available with a Platform API Token.

types.name: Platform
types.description:
Platform represents one of the platforms on which Manifold has published its
marketplace.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the Platform for internal usage.

fields.name: domain
fields.description: The domain associated with the platform.

types.name: Invoice
types.description: Invoice represents the total due in a specific billing period.

fields.name: cost
fields.description:
Cost is the amount due for the invoice.

The cost is provided in the currency’s smallest unit.

Example: `1000` is `1000 cents` which is `$10 USD`.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Currency is the currency of the `cost` field.

fields.name: start
fields.description: Start indicates when the invoice's period starts.

fields.name: end
fields.description: End indicates when the invoice's period ends.

fields.name: lineItems
fields.description: List LineItems composing the invoice.

types.name: Currency
types.description: Currency is the supported currency represented as an ISO currency code.

types.name: Time
types.description:
Time represents a point in time formatted as an
[RFC3339](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt) formatted string.

Example: `2009-11-10T23:00:00Z`

types.name: LineItemConnection
types.description: LineItemConnection is the connection between an invoice and its lineItems.

types.name: LineItemEdge
types.description: LineItemEdge is an edge of LineItemConnection

types.name: LineItem
types.description: LineItem represents the amount due for a resource.

fields.name: cost
fields.description:
Cost is the amount due for the associated resource.

The cost is provided in the currency’s smallest unit.

Example: `1000` is `1000 cents` which is `$10 USD`.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Currency is the currency of the `cost` field.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration is the time horizon for associated resource’s billing (monthly, yearly)

fields.name: renewalPoint
fields.description: RenewalPoint describes the renewal behavior (calendar, anniversary)

fields.name: chargeTime
fields.description: ChargeTime describes the charge behavior (post-paid, pre-paid)

fields.name: resource
fields.description: Resource is the resource accociated with this line item.

fields.name: subLineItems
fields.description: List SubLineItems composing the line item.

types.name: Duration
types.description: Duration is a representation of how long a cycle is.

types.name: RenewalPoint
types.description: RenewalPoint is a representation of when the cycle renewal occurs.

types.name: ChargeTime
types.description: ChargeTime is representation of when the charge for a cycle occurs.

types.name: Resource
types.description:
A resource represents the provisioned version of a selected product. It is
linked to a plan and has credentials associated with it.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: A human readable display name for this resource.

fields.name: label
fields.description: A machine readable label for this resource. It is unique per owner.

fields.name: plan
fields.description:
The plan for which this resource is provisioned. The plan can be null if the
resource is a custom resource, or if there's a transient failure.

fields.name: owner
fields.description:
The profile which owns the resource.

Note: if the resource is not owned by a Platform Profile, this will be null.

fields.name: credentials
fields.description: A list of credentials which are used to access the Resource

types.name: CredentialConnection
types.description:
CredentialsConnection allows a type to set up a connection to list associated
credentials.

types.name: CredentialEdge
types.description:
CredentialsEdge represents a single item on a Credentials Connection page which
has a cursor which can be used for pagination and holds the actual credential
information.

types.name: Credential
types.description:
Credential represents a plain text value for a credential which can be used to
configure a resource.

fields.name: key
fields.description: The key to which we can reference the credential as.

fields.name: value
fields.description:
The plain text value of the credential. This value is the value that can be
used in the actual configuration for the resource.

types.name: SubLineItemConnection
types.description: SubLineItemConnection is the connection between a lineItem and its subLineItems.

types.name: SubLineItemEdge
types.description: SubLineItemEdge is an edge of SubLineItemConnection

types.name: SubLineItem
types.description:
SubLineItem represents the break down by base cost, features and metered usage
of the amount due by resource.

fields.name: cost
fields.description:
Cost is the amount due for the feature.

The cost is provided in the currency’s smallest unit.

Example: `1000` is `1000 cents` which is `$10 USD`.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Currency is the currency of the `cost` field.

fields.name: plan
fields.description: Plan is the plan associated with the SubLineItem.

fields.name: item
fields.description: Item is the feature name (base-cost, or a customized name)

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description is the value for the feature, or a metering bucket.

fields.name: calculationType
fields.description: CalculationType defines the feature’s billing behavior (prorated, usage)

fields.name: start
fields.description: Start indicates when the feature started to take effect.

fields.name: end
fields.description: End indicates when the feature stopped to take effect.

types.name: CalculationType
types.description: CalculationType are the known calculation types possible for SubLineItems.

types.name: InvoiceOrderBy
types.description: InvoiceOrderBy defines how an invoice connection is to be ordered.

types.name: InvoiceOrderByField
types.description: InvoiceOrderByField is a the field by which an Invoice list will be ordered.

types.name: InvoiceConnection
types.description: InvoiceConnection is the connection between an entity and its invoices.

types.name: InvoiceEdge
types.description: InvoiceEdge is an edge of InvoiceConnection

types.name: ResourceConnection
types.description:
ResourceConnection allows a type to set up a connection to list associated
resources.

types.name: ResourceEdge
types.description:
ResourceEdge represents a single item on a Resources Connection page which has
a cursor which can be used for pagination and holds the actual resource
information.

types.name: WithUsage
types.description:
WithUsage allows fetching profiles that have been used after the start date,
before the end date or between the start and end date.

inputFields.name: start
inputFields.description: Start allows fetching profiles used after this date

inputFields.name: end
inputFields.description: End allows fetching profiles used before this date

types.name: ProfileConnection
types.description: ProfileConnection is the connection containing Profile edges

types.name: ProfileEdge
types.description: ProfileEdge is the edge of a ProfileConnection

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax (as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).
